column1: # IMPORTANT: Lines starting with a '#' are ignored by the game and should be used for instructions only.
# - To set a custom title make the first row: GameTitle Your Custom Game Title
# - To enable Judge Mode (an answer key view) add a second row: JudgeCode 123456 (use any 6-digit code)
# - The 'Round' column sets which round a clue belongs to (1 or 2). A game can have just Round 1, just Round 2, or both.
# - The app supports flexible board layouts!
#   - A round can have between 1 and 5 categories.
#   - Each category in a round must have the same number of clues (between 2 and 5).
# - The classic 5x5 layout is recommended, but custom sizes (e.g., 4 categories x 3 clues) will work. A confirmation will appear for non-standard layouts.
# - Category names MUST be identical for all clues within that category for a given round.
# - To add a Final Jeopardy round create one row where the 'Category' is 'FINAL JEOPARDY' and the 'Round' is 'FJ'.
# - The 'Value' column for this row should contain the Final Jeopardy category name (e.g., HISTORIC DOCUMENTS).
# - Set the 'DailyDouble' column to 'Yes' to make a clue a Daily Double. Leave blank or 'No' for normal clues.
#   - Use a publicly accessible DIRECT URL that ends in .jpg, .png, etc. Standard Google Drive/Dropbox *sharing* links will NOT work.
#   - You MUST use the **EMBED URL** (the URL found inside the iframe tag when sharing/embedding a video).

# - Paste rich HTML content directly into the 'MediaURL' cell. The app safely renders tags like
    and .
#   - Provide 2 to 5 answer options in the 'MC_Answers' column separated by semicolons (e.g. Choice A;Choice B;Choice C).
#   - The 'Answer' column must still contain the text of the correct response.
# - The 'Explanation' column is optional. Add any extra teaching notes you want to show after the correct response is revealed.
# - When using a TSV file, you don't need to worry about quoting cells that contain commas.
